metadata.Title: CVE-2019-17351 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in drivers/xen/balloon.c in the Linux kernel before5.2.3, as used in Xen through 4.12.x, allowing guest OS users to cause adenial of service because of unrestricted resource consumption during themapping of guest memory, aka CID-6ef36ab967c7.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-17351` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-174.204
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-174.204
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-174.204
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-60.67~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-60.67~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.15.0-60.67~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1066.73
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1102.113
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1047.49~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.15.0-1056.61
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.15.0-1041.43
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1022.25~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1129.138
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1133-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1133.141
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-174.204').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-60.67~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1066.73').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1102.113').
linux-aws-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1047.49~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1056.61').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1041.43').
linux-oracle package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1022.25~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1129.138').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1133.141').
